medical_history.chief_complaint: Lower abdominal pain localized to the right lower quadrant.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The pain started 3 days ago, with localization to the right lower quadrant for the past 2 days. The pain is constant and dull, with momentary increases to severe, sharp pain. The patient also had a fever of 101.2 this morning. There have been no nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, or dysuria, and bowel movements have been normal. No recent travel or unusual diet has been reported.
